author: {'steamid': '76561198140914585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1677315165}
review: Streets of Fury pays homage to every Capcom arcade beat-em-up I loved when I was a teenager, and even utilizes a combat system very similar to Marvel vs. Capcom and Night Stalkers.  The main issue I am having with the game is the laziness of the overall character design and aesthetic.  After a while (3 hours in my case), the game starts to feel monotonous since I don't really care about what is happening.  Castle Crashers is a similar game that keeps you wanting to progress further despite the obvious grind of beating up bad guys again and again.  The difference is the world that Behemoth built that is very engaging and detailed, while Streets of Fury feels like a demo that someone more inspired should reskin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014976648', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 20053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6213, 'last_played': 1704298775}
review:
This is the most fun I've ever had with a beat 'em up.

Streets of Fury EX certainly doesn't have the ambiance of Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles of Mystara, or the soundtrack of Streets of Rage, or the visuals of Capcom's Alien vs Predator.
But what the game lacks in artistic and technical prowess, it makes up for with its zany humour, large cast of playable characters, and awesome gameplay depth.
Each character feels very unique, and though a few can feel underpowered, they're still interesting in their own right. The combo system is super flexible - way more than I ever expected! Chain combos, special moves, dash and jump cancels, juggles, OTGs, and the coming update even adds parries to the mix. Hell we're still finding new ways to do amazing, super damaging combos!

Worth mentioning as well, a few internet and fighting game community figures are playable characters. Most of them are popular in France (this is a French game after all), like Mr Quaraté, Yamato and Bob Lennon, but you'll probably recognize Benzaie from the That Guy With The Glasses website. Well, the next update adds Kayane and Ryan Hart as playable characters as well!

This game is Heaven for completionists who want to get top marks on every mode, and want to master every character. There is a beefy challenge mode that will really test your skills, and higher difficulties for the main campaigns really bring on the pain. The one problem is the absence of online mode, but the campaign's second story will help scratch that multiplayer itch if you can't do local co-op (or local versus!).

And, hey, it DOES have an awesome soundtrack as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040381282', 'num_games_owned': 1023, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1680727264}
review: Dieses Spiel ist einfach nur von Vorne bis Hinten total bekloppt und durchgedreht, im Possitiven sinn. Es ist ein Klassisches beat’em up man Läuft von Links nach Rechts und haut alles um was sich bewegt. Die Grafik hat ihren eigenen scharm und passt auch in die ganze inszenierung des Spiels. Das Kampfsystem der einzelnen spielbaren Figuren ist im Großen und ganzen ausgewogen. Wobei man oft auch einfach nur Butten Mashing betreibt. Aber die ganzen Spezial Attacken sind einfach zu schön und immer wieder unterhaltsam. Der Sound Track des Spieles ist das beste am gesamten Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982670012', 'num_games_owned': 2385, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1476169578}
review:
A friend of mine and I tripped across this while looking for hilariously bad games on XBox Indies.  We started off laughing our asses off at the character sprites that looked like they were made by a few friends getting together on a Saturday with a camera or reading the bizarre character bios and backstories.  But then we found ourselves genuinely hooked on the combo happy multiplayer.  After finishing the demo we actually ponied up for the full version and played it all weekend.

Fast forward to 2016 when I noticed Streets of Fury EX randomly on Steam.  I wasted no time picking it up (and immediately  notifying my friend from before).  This "EX" version is largely the same as the XBox version, but it adds more content and higher resolution assets.

The game itself is a beat em up that takes a lot of queues from Guardian Heroes on the Sega Saturn.  You and your opponents shift between three vertical planes.  You'll be tasked with punching out scores of bad guys using one of a roster of characters that all look pretty much like normal people in their street clothes.  But just like Guardian Heroes you can easily pull off ridiculous combos by stringing together elaborate-but-easy-to-pull-off moves.  Lots of launching, air combos, juggling, and crowd controlling AOEs.  Inputs are simple and once you have the basics down you can be racking up combos in the hundreds in no time.  With up to 4 players going at it at the same time, things can get absolutely bananas.

So the gameplay is fun (though not necessarily perfectly balanced) but the presentation is definitely what got its hooks in me.  It's all very low budget and none of the "actors" look particularly menacing.  Bosses are usually just regular mobs that are scaled bigger or tinted a different color.  This may all sound unimpressive but it adds to the game's charm: it's clearly a low budget effort from a small team, but the game emulates the fun of Guardian Heroes exceptionally well.  The game can eventually get repetitive with a limited number of backgrounds and characters, but I say for those that know what they're getting into it's a hugely fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999871353', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1556676067}
review:
Wow...where to begin. This game is awesome. That's a good place to begin.
Not only am I loving the weird look that makes me feel like I'm playing a Midway game from way back when, but these controls are tight!

Combat feels smooth and looks great. You can really feel your character's power. Music is nice too. Super chill.
All this is wrapped up in a sense of humour that had me chuckling from time to time, and I had to hold it in cuz I'm at work.

And the characters may look bland and almost ridiculous, but they have MORE CHARACTER in just their body language than I've seen in any main character in a videogame in ages. Each one of them fights very differently, and it's up to you to try them each out until you feel the bond that's right for you.

Would I recommend it? Sure. If you like fun beat em ups that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016308878', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1632024984}
review: This and Dong Dong Never Die have convinced me that we need more fighting games with just normal real-life weirdos pulling out insane fighting powers.  Of course, that would still fail without a good flow of play, and thankfully Streets of Fury does well here too, with a loose combo system that lets you rack up a lot of hits with even a bit of practice.  The ability to go through with up to four players in Story and Versus modes is also a personal fave feature, and the music as you go through the streets (of fury) is unobtrusive and pleasant.  My only real gripe is that I do kind of wish there were more playable girls besides Ruby Diamonds, but overall the game is fun to play and hits that right mix of stupid and amazing that feels so perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074818415', 'num_games_owned': 1556, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1691831911}
review:
Hands down the most fun beat'em up I've ever played.

+ many unique characters to choose from - each one of them has an entirely unique fighting style
+ the controls are very easy to comprehend - clearly they were desinged for people who just want to mash buttons, and I applaud this approach
+ distinctive visual style
+ excess fun, not only thanks to the game mechanics (which are spot on), but also because you want to keep playing just to see what ridiculous crap did the devs come up with
+ even more fun in local multiplayer (up to 4 players, which is always nice)
+ the music fits the game's overall atmosphere
+ reasonably balanced difficulty, it manages to be challenging without being unfair
+ the game is still supported - a patch with new characters (including Nostalgia Critic) is on the way

- no online multiplayer
- enemies get very repetitive very quickly, although that's the case with many beat'em ups
- 21:9 screen ratio supported only in Vert- mode
- very short

author: {'steamid': '76561198152419995', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1583256427}

author: {'steamid': '76561198100413562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1596487608}
review:
Probado en una pc de 64 mb de vram, 2 gb de ram y 2 ghz de cpu, les puedo decir que funciona bastante estable, quizas tenga que quitar algo de calidad a los graficos, pero aun asi sigue viendose bien y tener una jugabilidad excelente.
En cuanto al gameplay, es bastante divertido, al principio me saco un poco de onda el como se mueven hacia arriba y abajo, pero me acostumbre muy rapido.
Por otra parte, la musica es otro buen logro, se nota mucho la inspiracion del clasico de sega genesis "Street of rage", pero esto sin tener que copiar ideas y conceptos de ese juego, teniendo su propio merito.
Los graficos es su principal fuerte, como podra notarse en el video e imagenes, es muy agradable jugar este juego manejando estos personajes a base de fotografias, y a esto sumenle el hecho de que hay una gran variedad, tanto de personajes como de enemigos.

Una compra muy recomendada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015233287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1656281830}
review:
I only played for 40 mins and felt like leaving a review.

This game made me laugh a lot! Its very comedic in the way fighters fight (redundance necesary there), and they made a great job at delivering really polished fighting mechanisms and a somewhat wide roster of fighters for this game (I think its the first entrance of this franchise and hopefully not the last one!!!).

It has local co-op and local PvP which is a HUGE bonus for games these days because most have a lack local playtime, and this game is very friendly on local gaming on the same PC. The sad part is that it doesn't seem to have online co-op, but there's a competitive fighting online mode though (a la Street Fighter IV or something around there) for those who enjoy PvP.

Great game to play with friends over your house and it has low graphics demand which is also very nice.

100% recommend it if you like beat'em ups, fighting games and playing with friends!

Devs, I hope you make Streets of Fury II someday in the future hahaha <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198024179567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1640458571}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034315837', 'num_games_owned': 7747, 'num_reviews': 765, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1666415176}
review:
Streets of Fury EX is an essential to any beatemup fan and if you got friends to play the local co-op... then stop reading this and buy it now! 
 
The fighting mechanics and combo system have depth and take skill to master but once you start getting better those seemingly impossible harder difficulties become manageable. One of the strengths of the game is that it can be enjoyed both as a simple button mashing fest or as a proper fighter with a combo system to finish off hordes of baddies depending on the difficulty setting making it a great fit for both casual and hardcore genre fans. The digitized roster is varied and with eight extra fighters to unlock to join the fray there's all kinds of brawling styles serious to comical to keep you entertained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292699563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1470762747}
review: I'll be the first to admit, I'm not a traditional fighting game lover. I play Smash Bros (not even Melee, I play Wii U). I was born long after the age of traditional arcade fighters as well, so I have no nostalgia-driven connection to these kinds of games.  On top of it all, I don't have an Xbox 360 controller to play this with; I'm typing this review with the same keyboard I use to play this game. Nevertheless, this game is so fun and charming. The controls are completely customizable and therefore very easy to pick up and start playing. While the game isn't super balanced, namely Bob Lennon destroys everyone, it is still fun and the wide array of characters prevents this moderate lack of balance from destroying the game. The game has two campaigns with several difficulties for each, so completing the game is a task for the dedicated. That being said, the game feels oddly shallow in content for some reason. But with a friend to play with, this is mostly negated. I bought this game at half-price for $4.99, and at that price the game is an 8.3/10. At full $9.99 price, the game receives a 7.9/10. Not a must-buy at either price, but definitely a fun and charming addition to any game library of any type of gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996186819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1705894961}
review:
This is the best beat'em up game I have ever played on Steam and since the mid-90's. It's USB generic controller friendly (I use an SNES controller). When the game starts it gives the option to play it in either OpenGL or DirectX (something all games should return to doing from the early 2000's).

The game pays true homage to Mortal Kombat 3, the original Killer Instinct, Streets of Rage and maybe even Double Dragon 3 on NES. The balance is completely right, even the stamina bar and unlocks! It looks cheesy, but make no mistake  ... it's extremely well designed! Do I recommend this game? Did I phück your wife? Hell phücking yes! Baise toi! And buy this game!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mujypfV7i-E

author: {'steamid': '76561197971253613', 'num_games_owned': 1502, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1650720740}
review:
This was a pleasant surprise in every sense of the word.

When you look at this, you probably want to laugh at how ridiculous this looks, yet how intriguing at its game play. In fact, I only bought this game because a friend of mine showed it to me one day. When he got me and a couple other friends together for a game, I was left impressed and amused. Naturally, I got curious enough to want to get the game now.

What can be said about this? Well you really cannot do any worse for $10. For $10, you get two campaign modes, five levels each, a good cast of playable characters with their own combo strings to discover, four player cooperative and competitive play, a few other games modes thrown in for good measure, you get enough to justify the price, yet it feels like a huge treat to me.

Maybe I'm being too favorable to it, so let me make it simple:
-Do you enjoy beat em ups?
-Do you enjoy fighting games?
-Do you still find digitized sprites to be charming?
-Do you plan on getting some friends together for some games?
-Do you enjoy something that's simple to figure out yet complex to master?
-Do you grow tired of beat em ups with RPG stats like I have?

You will find enjoyment in this game. I never regretted it, and there is a good chance that neither will you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996244206', 'num_games_owned': 4445, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1468809939}

This is a Steam hidden Gem game that deserves much more praise and spotlight to be put on it, its one of rthe most original and fun beat em ups Ive played in a long, long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030507789', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1468670950}
review:
Llevaba tiempo buscando un juego al estilo Street of Rage, saga que me encanta aun hoy jugar con mi novia, sea emulador o el remake hecho por fans. Buscaba algo parecido desde hacía tiempo por steam, el típico juego de ir dando mamporros a todo lo que se mueva para jugar en cooperativo, pero por desgracia soy un desconocedor de este género y la mayoría de juegos que encontraba eran de disparos estilo Metal Slug o Contra y eso ya no me gusta, hasta que di con Streets of Fury EX.

No se bien como analizar este juego, es un claro homenaje a Street of Rage y otros juegos de este estilo, quizá en un primero momento me chocó la estética de sus personajes (si, se hace muy extraño ver esas capturas de personas reales con fondos fotografiados y mezclados con gráficos simplones hechos por ordenador). Pero al final me decidí a comprarlo y no me arrepiento. La de risas que me estoy echando jugando en cooperativo, a parte de que disfruto del juego cada partida que juego. Ahora pasaré a comentar brevemente aquello que me parece reseñable del juego.

- La jugabilidad, pese a que el juego es el típico avanzar y aporrear a todos los enemigos nos encontramos con un muy buen sistema de combos, ademas de que cada personaje posee 3 tipos diferences de especiales que podemos ejecutar una vez llenamos nuestro medidor de "Fury". Un tutorial nos explica al principio el funcionamiento en profundidad del sistema de combate pero tendremos que dedicarle buenas horas a saber cuando protegernos, esquivar, atacar a ciertos enemigos, etc...

- La dificultad sin duda es elevada en los modos de juego Hard y en adelante, apenas he podido completarlo en cooperativo en Medium (aún no se jugarlo bien evidentemente), pero sin duda ofrece buenos ratos y un desafio para aquellos que les gusta rejugarlo en dificultades mayores. Ademas de que segun derrotemos enemigos y hagamos combos mas largos subiremos el "Security Level" con el cual podemos desbloquear el resto de personajes (son 15 en total) y otros modos de juego (otro modo historia, modo versus, survival, etc...).


No puedo decir nada malo pues era lo que quería y esperaba, es divertido, gracioso, extraño y alocado por momentos. Un indie que me ofrece aquello que buscaba, quizá eche en falta el poder coger armas (bates, tuberias, cuchillos, etc...) algo típico en muchos juegos de este género, pero ofrece un buen sistema de combate y combos en compensacion.

Sin duda lo recomiendo para aquellos que vayan a jugarlo acompañados, ya que solo se puede hacer algo pesado. La pena es que no tenga logros o cromos, un gran punto a favor para cumplir ciertos retos, rejugarlo mas, etc...

author: {'steamid': '76561198029853361', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1681059797}
review:
Me, brothers and some friends enjoy playing beat'n'up's. This one is by far our favorite. Alot of funny and cheesy characters often with parodies of fighting games. Extremely complex combo system (feel like a KoF god). Old Fatal Fury style "lanes" system that works even better than the freeform vertical movement usually on the genre (feels less cheesy, some attacks hit many lanes, giving even more skill variety).

The most satisfying beat'n'up I played even with the nostalgic feeling of my Genesis/Snes/Arcade times as a kid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200515955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1698985104}
review:
If you like the beat em up genre despite its quirky and repetitive nature, you will likely fall in love with this game as I did.
Do NOT expect a lengthy campaign in the slightest. The longevity of this game comes from beating the game on multiple difficulty settings and using different characters. You may also get a lot of mileage out of this game if you enjoy the self imposed challenge of a 1 credit clear. The cast of characters is diverse and their strengths and weaknesses are not very balanced, which isn't a negative for the genre. For a real challenge, do your best to master who you percieve as the weakest character and go for a 1 credit clear!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129204919', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1461507179}
review:
[h1]Streets of Fury EX[/h1]

Streets of Fury EX ist ein lustiges Spiel in dem es darum geht andere zu verprügeln. Es gibt auch eine Story in der es auch darum geht sich mit anderen zu Prügeln.

[h1]Inhalt[/h1]

[b]Story[/b]

Paris ist gefallen,
Straßenbanden haben die Kontrolle übernommen.
Die Armee ist machtlos gegen die gehärtete Kriminalität.
Sie und Ihre Bande sind eingestellt worden,
direkt von den Straßen von LA,
durch die verängstigte französische Regierung.
Ihre Mission ist es, die Banden zu vernichten und die
frühere Sicherheit wiederherzustellen und die macht dem Präsidenten zurückzugeben.
Die nationale Einheit stützt sich auf deine Fäuste.
Es ist Zeit, Feuer mit Feuer zu bekämpfen.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Bevor du anfängst zu Kämpfen kannst du dir einen Kämpfer auswählen, am Anfang hast du nur fünf Kämpfer aber du schaltest immer mehr Kämpfer im Laufe des Spiels frei.
Im Kampf kommen eigentlich immer die gleichen Gegner, nur wenn du den Boss besiegst kommen neue dazu.
Es gibt drei verschiedene Modi auf denen du Spielen kannst, zuerst kommt der Kampagne Modus in dem du die Story durch spielst, dann kommt der challenge Modus den du erst mit Level 5 freischaltest in dem geht es darum verschiedene aufgaben zu erledigen, danach kommt der Survival Modus den du erst mit Level 18 freischaltest in dem geht es darum so lange zu Kämpfen bis du Stirbst.

[h1]Grafik und Sound[/h1]

Die Grafik ist sehr gut gelungen, die Menschen sind echt nur der Hintergrund ist so animiert das alles sehr gut zusammen passt.
Der Sound ist auch sehr gut jede Attacke hat einen eigenen Sound.

[h1]Postiv[/h1]

-Passende Grafik
-Guter Sound
-Viele Maps
-Viele Kämpfer
-Guter Preis

[h1]Negativ[/h1]

-Ein paar Bugs

[h1]Wertung[/h1]

[b]Spielspaß 95/100[/b]
Am Anfang ist das Spiel sehr schwierig aber wenn man eine Stunde gespielt hat bringt das Spiel einem sehr viel Spaß.

[b]Grafik 90/100[/b]
Die Grafik ist sehr gut, die Menschen sind echt nur der Hintergrund wurde animiert und es passt sehr gut zusammen.

[b]Sound 80/100[/b]
Der Sound ist sehr gut, jede Attacke hat einen eigenen Sound.

[b]Technik 85/100[/b]
Der Aufbau des Spiels ist immer gleich erst kommt ein Text in dem steht wo der Kampf ist dann kämpfst du und wenn du gewonnen hast kommt das gleiche nochmal.
Das Spiel hat ein paar Bugs aber ist noch nie abgestürzt.

[b]Maps 75/100[/b]
Die Maps sind immer 2D mit mehreren Stufen. Der Standort des Spiels ist in Paris und es gibt auch sehr viele Maps aber irgendwann hat man auf jeder Map mal gespielt und dann wird es Langweilig.

[h1]Gesamt 80/100[/h1]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]

Ein sehr gutes und lustiges Kampf-Spiel das jedem Spaß bringen wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044140048', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1682804204}
review: I had super low expectations when I looked this game up on accident, but boy did I find a hidden gem! SoF EX is like Streets or Rage with MvC2 like comboing. I haven't played much of the game but I do need to come back to it later down the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054902790', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1435932204}
review:
Streets of Fury est donc un titre qui ravira les fan de Beat Them All des années 90 grâce à des possibilités de Gameplay nombreuses et malgré un style graphique qui ne plaira pas à tous. Il faut bien garder en tête que le jeu est volontairement décalé et que plus vous avez d'amis pour y jouer plus vous allez vous éclater en coopération ou en mode Versus. On regrettera l'absence d'un mode Online ce qui réduit malheureusement l'intérêt de l'achat du jeu si vous n'avez pas d'amis à proximité mais qui renforce l'hommage fait aux titres du genre sortis il y a plus de vingt ans.

Test complet : http://aquab0n.fr/2015/07/test-streets-of-fury-ex.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198090524985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1593839665}
review:
A solid, surprisingly deep beat-em-up. Battles are in 2D, but take place on multiple "planes" that you can jump between at will, much like Guardian Heroes. Combat is heavily based on a wide variety of devastating "Fury" moves like upheaving bursts of fire, powerful area-of-effect clearing blasts, and excessive punch combos. 

The most notable point is that despite the gameplay, the game's graphics and art direction are hilarious: it's a hilarious parody of games like Pit Fighter and early Mortal Kombat, but seemingly much more self-aware and in on the joke, which works well with the game's atmosphere. It works extremely well as a "parody" of the genre, but doesn't skimp on the gameplay as a result, as the battles are a bit more involved than the average beat-em-up, what with the wide variety of moves.

The only real issue is the lack of online co-op. Aside from that, if you're a fan of beat-em-ups and the early 90's digitized photo graphics aesthetic, and like beat-em-ups that aren't just button mashing, don't hesitate to pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146664852', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1588947940}
review:
Es ist ein richtig lustiges Spiel und die 10 € wirklich wert! :D Die Characktere sind meiner Meinung nach dank ihren lustigen Verhöhnern und ihren unrealistischen Moves alle total bescheuert (im positiven Sinne), man wird beim Spielen oft zum Lachen gebracht :D 
Außerdem macht es Spaß mit der Zeit die Bosse freizuschalten und mit ihnen zu kämpfen, und das aller beste ist die "Bestie" die man mit lvl 100 bekommt, es macht so viel Spaß mit diesem Char zu spielen, aber ich möchte nicht zu viel verraten ;) 
Ich würde dieses Spiel jedem empfehlen, der mal ein lustiges Spiel für zwischendurch sucht, für mich persönlich hat es sich mehr als gelohnt!^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198010134164', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1616259973}
review:
A really, REALLY great beat-em-up game. Good fighting mechanics, very flexible combo system, smooth controls, smooth gameplay and the zany cutscenes and characters are actually pretty funny. This game quite literally turned out from "lol this looks pretty fun and funny" to "Holy shit this one of my favorite games" despite me not being a big fighting game fan.
Too bad the game desperately needs more campaigns and an online multiplayer mode for co-op and versus. You can get some replayability trying to finish the game on Insane and practicing all the characters but if you don't want to play the same modes all the time it can get pretty boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131964133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1660275407}
review:
AMAZING game! I had lots of fun playing through the game both alone and with friends. A great challenge and the characters are all hilarious, I laughed every time I played.

However, my friends and I were let down by the fact that there's only 2 plans! Perhaps more plans through future updates or even letting users create their own levels would be so awesome. Online multiplayer would be cool, but I don't think it would hold the same merit as getting all your friends together to play SoF. All in all, 9/10 game. Excellent work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073575307', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1436719914}
review:
[url=http://www.le-serpent-retrogamer.org/street-of-fury-ex-mortal-kombat-x-street-of-rage/]> Retrouvez cette critique en images sur le Serpent Retrogamer <[/url]

[b]Dans le début des années 1990, un nouvel artifice graphique dans les jeux vidéo est perçue comme le summum du réalisme : les images digitalisées. Le principe est de prendre des vidéos de vrais acteurs et de les numériser pour en faire des sprites. L’exemple le plus connu reste le jeu Mortal Kombat et ses fatality. Mais malgré d’autres exemples de jeux, la mode s’estompe assez vite tandis que la 3D fait son entrée, pour revenir 20 ans plus tard. Les développeurs Français de Guard Crush Games décident de rendre hommage à leur façon avec une beat them all, non pas en 8 bit ni en 3D mais avec des acteurs. Le résultat s’appelle Street Of Fury EX, reste à savoir si cette originalité fait un jeu.[/b]

[h1]PARIS BRÛLE T-IL?[/h1]

Dans cette reprise de Street Of Rage, le scénario tient sur une demi feuille de papier. La ville de Paris est complètement submergée par les gang dans une version catastrophique des émeutes de 2005, et même l’armée est en grève. L’Etat Français fait appel à vous, membre des grang de L.A pour faire le nettoyage et rétablir la sécurité. Vous allez donc dans le mode campagne affronter les caïd un à un , chacun ayant ses propres coups spéciaux et son armée de sbires prêts à se battre jusqu’à la mort. Pendant la sélection des personnages, on sent le bon cliché de la rue : des messieurs à capuches, des flingues, des wesh ma gueule ou encore des karatékas (?). Le fait que tous ont été digitalisés a partir de l’équipe de développement rend le résultat plutôt mythique. Un guest vient d’ailleurs s’incruster dans la bataille, bien connu des habitués de youtube : Benzaie.  Mais passons au jeu en lui même, et aux techniques de combat de nos guerriers des rues. Pour vaincre les ennemis, le joueur possède trois coups : un coup classique qui fait peu de dégâts et deux coups puissants plus utiles. Ces deux derniers utilisent cependant de l’endurance et il faudra récupérer entre deux séries de mandales. Enfin une barre de fury se remplit tout au long des combats, permettant de lancer des coups spéciaux à la manière d’un Street Of Rage. L’avantage de Street OF Fury EX est de proposer des variantes des coups cités ci-dessus que ce soit par l’ajout d’une direction, par une fury associé à chaque bouton ou des combos. Ajoutez à cela des conbos, et vous obtenez un jeu avec un gameplay digne d’un jeu de combat de la période Street Fighter 2. Et c’est bien là sa seule qualité, car pour être honnête : on s’ennuie.

[h1]UN DÉLIRE DE DÉVELOPPEURS NE FAIT PAS UN BON JEU[/h1]

En mettant de côté le parti pris graphique des images digitalisées, qui ne plaira pas à tout le monde mais qui est assumé, le jeu ressemble plus à un trip sous acide des développeurs mis tel quel en mouvement. Les environnements sont tout d’abord très peu inspirés, et on alternera entre ville/métro/ville/métro, avec seulement quelques plans modifiés. Je ne dis pas que Paris est une ville multicolore, mais là c’est déprimant, et le level design n’arrange pas les choses. Pas de phases en scrolling forcé, d’intérieurs (sauf le métro), pas de plateformes (Double Dragon), ici on avance et on tape, en espérant ne pas brûler ses précieux crédits. Il y a bien trois niveaux de profondeur pour varier les plaisirs mais on touche au principal problème de EX : son côté répétitif. J’avais fait à peu près la même remarque pour Hyrule Warriors, à savoir foncer dans des ennemis à l’IA très variable en enchaînant coups-attaque spéciale-coups-…, avant de passer à la suite. On peut essayer tous les personnages disponibles, et débloquer les autres pour voir leur set de mouvements, mais si le reste ne suit pas on en revient à toujours prendre le même membre de gang. On essaye alors les autres modes comme les “Challenges” ou le “Survival” mais ce ne sont que des variantes basés sur le même jeu de base, donc vite lassantes. Bon point néanmoins, le multijoueur jusqu’à 4 peut permettre dans une soirée arrosé de délirer entre potes une fois ou deux. Pour résumer une bonne déception.

[h1]A retenir[/h1]

[b]Street Of Fury EX partait du principe qu’il fallait faire du second degré (scénario, graphisemes) mais oublie de nombreuses choses dans le jeu final. Malgré un gameplay plutôt fourni, le jeu est assez répétitif, plutôt moche et équipe ses ennemis d’une IA assez incompréhensible. Seul le multijoueur rattrape un peu le tout et permet de passer une ou deux soirées sympas avec des bières. A prendre à petit prix ou si vous êtes fan de Benzaie.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198195036314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 36, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1711274085}
review:
Le jeu est trop cher pour ce qu'il offre. 
Je change d'avis je recommande tout de même parce que le gameplay est putain jouissif et addictif.
C'est frustrant que le jeu soit si "vide". Mais la mecanique de gameplay est un pur bonheur.
En solde la pillule passe toute seule. A plein tarif ca reste trop cher a mon avis.

Le level design est très répétitif, on a un peu l'impression que c'est toujours les 3 meme niveaux et qui sont pas bien longs. C'est un peu chiant. Pas de multi online, la music est vraiment naze ( techno de la foire du trône pour des thugs du 21eme siecle ) et surtout ne sonne pas du tout "racaille". Pas un beat de hip-hop malgré les titres de niveaux qui laisseraient penser ça.
Y'a 3 persos et demi pour faire les ennemis et tout ce qui change c'est leur couleur ou taille.
Tout ce qui fait l'interet de ce jeu c'est Benzaie, Bob Lenon (eux on fait vraiment bien leur persos) et la nostalgie. A 10 balles c'est trop cher. Mais bon ca a le mérite d'être drôle.
C'est un bon mauvais jeu. Ca aurait plus de sens si yavait JDG.

Il y a de très bon point et notemment que franchement c'est très drole. C'est un joyeux bordel.
L'animation est fluide et la mechanique de combos est franchement sympa.
Si vous avez envie de rire et que les beat em all oldschool vous manque....

Bref c'est fendart mais ca reste trop cher pour ce que c'est... en esperant que ca s'update :) Et qu'ils le porte sur GNU/linux/steamOS...

review:

Ce jeu est tout simplement jouissif et un défouloir parfait, ce qui ne lui enlève en rien son côté très technique. 
Mixez, Street Of Rage, Mortal Kombat et des persos tous plus dingues les uns que les autres et vous obtenez STREET OF FURY EX.

Donc à tous les fans de versus fighting et de Beat'hem all foncez les yeux fermés !

author: {'steamid': '76561198025965617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1511130440}
review:
Agréablement surpris. 
> Les contrôles sont simple à assimiler (perso j'utilise Xppader pour jouer à la manette) 
> Le jeu est très bien opti, plutôt beau (graphisme sont moyens mais correct et en haute def).

Mention spéciale pour Bob qui peut combotter (QHoritontal+QHache[vershautjecrois]+crochepied+QH...) de façon très agréable et récupérer les ennemis au sol avec le petit croche-pied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045139551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1451690071}
review:
実写取り込みのアクションゲーは全部バカゲーだと思っていませんか？

その通りです。
さらに嘘くさい日本語台詞やくだらなーいモーション。
色々なゲームからパク...いやインスパイアされた技等
個人的にはやっぱりこうだよね！っていう作り。

横スクロールのお手軽コンボアクションゲーとしてみれば60点。
そこに実写取り込み大好き点で＋20点。
そんな感じです。数世代前の正統派といえるバカゲー。
PS、SS、3DO等で妙に実写ゲーが好きだったあなたにオススメの一品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198015685363', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1451631159}
review:
Great game. You can't just button mash. You have to figure out how to approach some enemies, and they all have different abilities, so you can't just keep rushing in and trying to start your standard combo.

Combos are fun to pull off, and fairly satisfying.

The visual style is unique and ridiculous (as you can see from the screenshots and video, it's normal-looking people mo-capped), perfectly fitting for what it is. Because it's so blatantly ridiculous, I think it's funny.

The story is also ridiculous just like every other side-scrolling beat-em-up. Don't worry about it.

Music and sound, also great and perfectly fitting for the thing. I think the hit sounds having a bit more oomph would make combos feel a bit more satisfying, but it's alright as it is now.

I was hoping to see some bboys because the French are known for bboying, but I didn't see anything like that. Maybe in a future update or something lol.

All in all a great game. Worth the full price especially to support the devs because this is mad fun, and a must-have if you like clever beat-em-ups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151024324', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1708352752}
review:
都没有看到中文评测，我来简单说一下试玩感受吧！
这个游戏我当时一看到介绍视频，就想起了国人制作的《东东不死传说》。和东东不同的是，这款游戏是横版过关游戏，给我一种新的体验。
里面可选的角色还是很多的，随着等级的提升，可以解锁非常多可用的角色，每个角色都很有特点。有的比较正常，有的……丧心病狂（各个方面都丧心病狂……）
所有的角色都是真人，我个人还是很喜欢这种设定的。相比“东东”来说，这款游戏的人物要丰满了许多，各种细节刻画的很出色，所以对于画面没有很大期待的我来说，算是一个惊喜吧！
最后是重点了，那就是打击感和连续技啦！本作的打击感还是可以的，连续技配合非常多，只要可以摸到对手的身体，什么招式都可以连！各种浮空，各种追加，非常爽！每个角色还有三种超杀，空中也可以放超杀~不过也不是逆天，因为加入了保护设定，被浮空一定程度之后，会强行落地（保护），这样不至于一套把人连死，还是比较平衡的。
战斗中，会显示连击数，连击结束之后，会显示这次连击的总伤害值，可以明确的知道自己这套连击造成的伤害。
唯一不爽的……居然没有翻滚…只有一个后跳…被两面包夹的时候很不爽！！！！
最后推荐大家买买买，如果喜欢横版过关和格斗的话，不要犹豫了，很好玩！！

Pour un jeu à petit budget je lui donne un gros GOTY / 20 !

author: {'steamid': '76561197995814206', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1503252293}
review:
OOOOOOH que c'est bon! 
Je veux dire, non seulement le gameplay est simple d'acces mais il s'offre le luxe de devenir éxigeant et profond, et ça on s'en rend compte rapidement (en gros dés que les 1er liens sortent), on est quelque part entre street fighter, double dragon et super smash bros. 
Le style graphique retro/cheapos avec les persos digitalisés fonctionne bien et renforce l'ambiance nanard assumé avec une bonne brouette d'humour.
Grosse mention spécial pour la présence de Benzaie , Bob lennon et Mr quaraté en persos jouables (et completement craqués au passage), Le GWAK mon gars!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104281338', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1450730410}
review:
Une excellente surprise!

Une reprise maitrisée des codes des Beat'em all de l'époque, réaffinés avec un tas de subtilités modernes et originales.

Ne vous laissez pas méprendre par le rendu photo, qui laisserai penser qu'il s'agit d'un simple jeu "kitch", ce jeu est une mine de techniques et combos à découvrir et à optimiser.

On sent l'influence de jeux comme Guardian Heroes de Treasure, ou la série des Real Bout Fatal Fury de SNK, mais aussi un tas d'autres grands noms du genre Beat'em all/Versus Fighing.

Le jeu est jouable jusqu'à 4 en même temps, avec un mode solo en coop à l'ancienne, et un mode versus à 4 totalement jubilatoire!

Sans compter que le jeu est régulièrement mis à jour avec l'ajout de persos totalement gratuitement ;)

Bref, je vous le recommande les yeux fermés :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198090776536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1447192385}
review: Игра настолько казуальная, что я пока не увидел ни одного русского обзора, поэтому решил написать свой. Это действительно файтинг для любителей, здесь все построенно на пофигизме, юморе и брутальности. Играет качевая музыка, интерфейс имеет простой дизайн. Действие происходит во Франции, где вы играете за задротов или просто странных смешных людей, есть уличные танцоры, дылды, просто психи и очкарики металлисты, у каждого свои приемы и движения. Стоит заметить, что в игре используется особый принцип графики, все люди вставлены из видеозаписей, то есть это не компьютерные 3D модели, а слой видео. Самый сок игры должен почувствоваться если играть с другом, короче игра нормальная, если нравится такой жанр, то можно смело пополнять свою инди-коллекцию.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083824217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 20681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2277, 'last_played': 1452702930}
review:
Après quelque heures, on commence à maitriser et à avoir du fun évidemment.
Une espèce de double dragon-like mais en mode indépendant.

Les personnages sont assez nombreux, les bruitages sont excellents,les combos sont vraiment funs et stylés.
Je vous conseille de jouer à la manette bien sûr.

L'originalité réside dans le fait que les personnages ne sont pas des sprites mais des "vraies personnes "(digitalisées) elles-même.

Cela rappelle un peu l'ancien street fighter avec jean-claude vandamme et les persos en digitalisé également .

Bref du bonheur ,par contre la communauté et les développeurs ont l'air mous du cul ,car ça fait plus de 24 h que j'ai annoncé que je n'avais pas la musique en fait (et peut-être vous également , mais c'est règlable je pense) et je n'ai pas de réponse.Bah, même sans musique cela va mais bon ...Donc je le recommande.

Et je rajoute ceci mais la communauté n'est pas cool désolé...Aucune réponse, que cela soit d'un des développeurs ou d'un joueur inscrit sur le forum du jeu (J'ai écris 3 messages quand même).

Donc le jeu est vraiment stylé oui , mais les développeurs ont l'air d'errer dans la banlieue de Paris du jeu en question,le chef des gangs a dû les "buter" ^^...

author: {'steamid': '76561198198318025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1620917487}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116338224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1450997386}
review:
This game is a parody of old school beat-em-up games. A really good parody!

Seriously, on my first playthrough I couldn't stop smiling or laughing even when i tried. If you played this kind of games in the 90s you'll know what I'm talking about when you play this one :P

Anyway, the fighting mechanics are solid; in fact they are better than most old beat-em-ups. There are a lot of  playable/unlockable characters with unique personalities and fighting styles. And, for the most part, their animations are very smooth. The gameplay can be a bit repetitive, but very polished and challenging.

I wish they included more female characters and female enemy npcs. In fact, I wish they had a bigger variety of unique enemies as a whole, especially when it comes to the bosses. Still, by combining different enemy types on each level the game will push you to keep coming up with new strategies.

The one thing that failed to impress me is the level design. Levels are kind repetitive and flat. In the old-school fighting games you were fighting on moving trains, inside buildings, inside elevators, on beaches, in gardens, etc. There were bystanders, destructible barrels and boxes, power-ups and weapons that you could pick up. Not here unfortunately. Most of the time in Streets of Fury you are fighting either in the streets, parking garages, or the subway platform, but the textures and colors are so similar for each location that it feels like you are on the same stage over and over.

Despite the shortcomings, Streets of Fury EX is a great game. Well worth the $10 price. I really want a sequel. (But please improve level design!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003411306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1539972653}
review:
Short review:

http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/431571327798766106/93745073670DC86C31A3BED192BD073E62DD89D8/

I just did a 1191 hit combo with a skinny French boxer. What other game allows you to do that?

---------------------------------

Long review:

This game plays very, very nice. The graphics may look like doodoo, but when the gameplay is so excellent, it really doesn't matter. It's kind of charming in its own way.

Mechanics:
Your characters have a lot of attacks and you can do all sorts of crazy juggle combos; just watch the trailer to see the kind of extreme techniques that you have at your disposal. You'll never feel limited and you'll keep wanting to discover more and more combos.

Controls: 
Sharp, on point. This is very important in a beat em up. Button layout is easy to comprehend.

Music:
Very catchy music! It resembles 90s techno, which is the perfect tribute to a classic beat em up.

Extras:
Co-op is couch 4 player and players can jump in. There are two campaigns and while they share similar areas, you recruit CPU allies in the second one to help out. There is also Challenge, Survival and Versus. The game can be very challenging on Normal, don't be ashamed to play on Easy or ask a friend to join you.


Conclusion:

Just buy the game, it's way too much fun! A wonderful tribute to old beat em ups and lots of nods to 2D fighting games. There's even Jesse from Breaking Bad as a playable character! At 10 bucks, it's a steal. You'll get plenty of your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103931265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2231, 'last_played': 1608823688}
review:
Alors là... mais alors là ...un grand bravo j'ai hésité avant de l'acheter mais alors là c'est du lourd, ça fait longtemps que j'avais pas prit un pied pareil, ce jeu est WTF.

Avec un petit rééquilibrage (oui pcq Benzaie et Jean Louis sont cheatés) "Street of Fury EX" peut finir à l'EVO (bin ouai pquoi pas , si DIVE KICK à réussi x).

Pour résumer

Points NEGATIVES.
- Le manque cruel de "female character" ... une fille c'est pas assez (en plus elle est très moyen :/)
- Le fait de pas pouvoir jouer en ligne avec la communauté Steam (versus ou coop) mais bon c'est un jeu à petit buddet on va pas exagérer.
- La posture de garde de " SAM I AM" ... bin ouai c'est quand meme une parodie de "Terry Bogard"  il est pas assez  Badass dans certains de ces mouvements et aussi sur la tenue en général.

Points POSITIVES
- L'Humour.
- Les Combos de malades oO.
- La bande son de ouf 
- Les Taunts trop mdr.
- La rejouabilitié.
- la vulgarité du personnage "Benzaie".
- L'anglais de YAMATO : "After beat it you down , I will eat a STEACK FRITES" ^^
- Ce Jeu c'est du Lourd (SHUT UP and take my money).
#REKAKAKU  x)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1434533751}
review:
[h1]Streets of Fury EX est un jeu de baston et ça cogne, je vous rassure[/h1]

Ce qui est génial avec Streets of Fury EX, c’est déjà en lui même le jeu, il est très bien fait mais aussi que ce sont des Français derrière cette petite merveille.

Les défauts, c’est que le jeu soit tout en anglais et son absence d’intégration avec Steam, j’aurais bien aimé avoir des succès !


L’histoire ? Les gangs contrôlent Paris, le gouvernement fait appel à un gang américain pour nettoyer la ville.

Tous les personnages du jeu sont réels. Je suppose qu’ils ont été filmés dans leurs différents mouvements puis intégrés au jeu. Chaque personnage possède ses propres forces et ses propres faiblesses ainsi que des coups spécifiques.

En progressant dans le jeu et en montant de niveau, vous débloquerez de nouveaux combattants.


Streets of Fury 2, c’est le nettoyage de Marseille et Lyon ?


[url=www.graal.fr/2015/06/25/test-streets-of-fury-ex-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour découvrir toutes mes impressions sur Streets of Fury EX.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198151589691', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1655319353}
review: I think this is a really good game.With a roster of 15 characters this game can really occupy your time because of how fun it is.Imagine having a ton of madness going on with 4 players which will make the expirence of this game even better.And when you decide to do a 4 player co-op or versus match then make sure to bring friends along because this game has no online play.But besides that one negative the game is really fun and I really reccommend lots of people to play this game.The final rating I give this game is a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003081163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 662, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1435925569}
review:
상점페이지에 로컬 코옵뿐만 아니라 멀티와 코옵이 적혀있었는데

실제로 없습니다. 그래서 전 환불을 받았습니다.

게임성은 그냥 노잼입니다.

실사를 캡쳐한것 이외에 장점은 없는 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561197962082784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1664332183}
review:
Yeah yeah it has mocap people. Shut up. I thought it looked stupid too. But here's the thing. It isn't. It's REALLY good. These guys know what a beat 'em up is. They know it is something more than just throwing quarters in to mash attack on a big jerk (Though that is a part of it, of course.). Solid hits, great combos. It does punching armies of thugs extremely well.

Don't take my word for it. Try the demo. I promise you it will surprise you.

Here, let me sell it to you another way: This is the sequel to Guardian Heroes we deserve. Not Advance Guardian Heroes (Not a bad experiment but seriously flawed). Not Code of Princess (A mess built by people who forgot what made GH good.).

author: {'steamid': '76561198048359786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1658651519}
review: An overall awesome game, fighting and movements are fluid and almost perfectly looped and in tune with eachother. One thing I would like to see in a future update however is online multiplayer, there's no way of connecting with other players as far as I've seen, and there isn't a way for two people to share a keyboard, I'd give it a ten out of ten if it had online multiplayer, for now it's an 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072279957', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1589023711}
review:
Streets of Fury EX is that epic beat'em'up game you always wanted to play where the characters were real people filmed and then put into the game.

A pure combat beat'em'up for anyone who's played beat'em'ups before (or anyone who hasn't). It has one of the most in- depth comabt systems I've ever seen in a fighting game. It may not have all the conventional things of other beat'em'ups such as health items and power-up but it more than makes up for it with the combat system. Easy to learn, hard to master.
And I haven't even mentioned the animations. The characters have so much... well.... character to them probably because they're all real people! Once you see them here you'll want them in every game.

Did I mention you can unlock the boss characters to play as? Did I mention the level exploi....... I mean 4-player co-op?
Did I mention survival mode?

The only criticism I have for this game is just a personal preference. IT NEEDS ONLINE!!!

If you're still undecided by now don't read any more reviews. Hit the button that says "Download Demo" and decide for yourself. DO IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042887256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1536343708}
review:
As a fan of side-scrolling beat-em-ups, I was a massive advocate of the original SoF on XBLIG and got loads of my friends into it. So you can imagine my delight on discovering that this game wasn't going to die as an unknown cult classic and that they were doing an updated version for PC.

IMHO, this is the best "Go Straight" beat-em-up after Streets of Rage Remake, but that has the advantage of already having a template, music, sprites, etc to work from. Streets of Fury, however, has a far better combo system! Seriously, the amount of variety and personalisation of the combos is a joy. It's also taken a leaf or two from the Saturn/XBLA classic Guardian Heroes, which is probably the other member of the "Best Scrolling Beat-em-ups Trilogy".

Yeah, the graphics can look a bit dodgy a first glance - but look at the animation! The more you look at and play with the characters, the work more you see has gone into making some excellent game mechanics. The music's great, there's loads of interesting and diverse characters, 4-player co-op/versus, unlockables, a couple of fun modes, etc and from what I hear, there's more content in the pipeline... This won't convert people who hate the genre, but there's definitely something quite pure and essentially videogamey about a game like this that a lot of people will enjoy - definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970791168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 31559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25446, 'last_played': 1709414479}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976574381', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1459034636}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121263008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1619483752}
review:
I picked this up after seeing another play it on a Stream.  For an old school "go right" beat-em-up there is a good deal of content and system mechanics like a stamina bar, guardbreaking;  Add that to numerous special & super moves, combos and fighters galore. Not to mention modes makes for a fun run in these streets.
Each character possess a varied style from the other and most are easy to pick up to the point you're more concerned with bringing up your combo. Over time though, even the ones with a steeper difficulty curve can dish out some sick looking beatdowns.

The story a lil out there, Paris is under control by gangs. The police and government unable to stop them decide to bring a gang from LA to do the job. Are you a bad enough dude...wait wrong game. Just hit the pavement and dish out the pain! Going solo or with 3 others you have to do the job someone else can't.  

Crazy fun with enough to make you come back for more.

There is only one real drawback I see to this but, I can tolerate it. And thats the lack of online. That's will probably keep others away from this and thats a shame, its a solid title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1535471273}
review:
Streets of Fury was the best beatemup on the Xbox Live Indie Games Service.
...
Wow. That's not saying anything at all.
Ok.
Streets of Fury EX is one of the best beatemups on Steam.
Eh? Eh?!
What? That's still not saying anything? Jeeze.

Beatemups are a tough genre to figure out. When you break it down enough, it's just walking up to people and punching them in the face. However, there's much more to it than that. This is a genre that demands perfect mechanics, solid controls, and the right balance of challenge, depth, and entertainment. Most developers don't even get the mechanics right, let alone everything else. 

Streets of Fury EX gets practically everything right. On first glance it looks ridiculous, but that's part of its charm. Not everyone is going to be nostalgic of games starring digitized characters, but I don't know. I kinda hope they'll make a come-back. It also helps that the cast of characters are uh...mostly normal. It reminds me of Dong Dong Never Die. That was a game filled with random people that can somehow throw fireballs, soar through the air, and cause earthquakes when they stomp the ground. 

There are 15+ playable heroes in SoFEX. Each fighter has a set of regular moves, special attacks, and a handful of supers. Combining these techniques to create combos is extremely enjoyable. Even during the beatemup genre's peak (the 90s) most combos were just mashing the attack button to perform automatic moves. With this game, if it keeps the enemy in the air, it counts. This game uses a lot of ideas present in other fighters, such as ground bounces, launchers, and OTG shenanigans. Basically, this means that you have a lot of tools to play around with. While unnecessary, it's also nice that each character has a distinct personality. Most of them have multiple taunts as well as unique "death" animations.

While it would probably be enough to create a bunch of dullard enemies to style on, SoFEX relies on making every enemy unique. There are a ton of re-used sprites (as per genre-standards), but they all have different strategies. Let's look at the Jesse Pinkman knock-offs. These jerks use guns. The orange Jay Cees don't attack, but will shoot you out of the air. Red? He taunts and then fires, which has the added affect of making him partially invulnerable (unless guard-broken). As for green, he just fires with no warning, but has no invincibility. No Jessy can be approached in the same manner. This ideal extends to the entirety of the enemy roster. 

The two campaigns do a fine job of exploring the possible enemy combinations. Eventually you'll grasp what works, and try to maximize your damage in the few openings you can create. It's the perfect showcase for the real depth that can be found in a beatemup. In order to beat someone down, you have to work for it. This aspect is further driven into the player's head in the Survival mode. In each wave, the player must contend with increasing odds. The enemies are randomized, which can result in an numerous combinations. It's up to the player to use the myriad of tools at their disposal to separate foes from the pack and give them a quick yet thorough crushing. The bad-guys will not shy away from making the player suffer. In later waves, a single screw-up can lead to the player getting juggled for half their health. 

For another kind of challenge, the...uh..challenge mode offers numerous battles. It's almost like a puzzle game. You have to figure out the right character, what enemies to focus on, and which moves to perform. There are a few "kick everyone's ass" missions, but most of the time you're going to try different combinations and ideas until you find the one that really works. It's a satisfying addition. An amusing bonus that shouldn't be ignored is the campaign edit. Various parameters can be changed, from enemy aggressiveness & numbers to gravity to how fast everyone moves. This can result in tons of hilarity, as well as even more ways to play through the game. 

More important than anything else: This is a beatemup that just [i]feels[/i] right. The mechanics are properly handled. There is enough satisfaction when punching an enemy, as well as appropriate warning when an enemy is going to attack. This is accomplished through animations and flashing effects. If you have a watchful eye and keep your ears open, you'll always have an idea of what's going on, even when 10+ enemies are on-screen. Every hit is on-point, nothing feels cheap or leaves you thinking "how'd he hit me?! He was way over there!" Within minutes of playing you get a feel for how everything works, and can start working on the finer details as well as developing your own amazing combos. 

This game is missing online-play...which hurts bad. The last release didn't have it either but damn, I hope it happens eventually. Couch co-op is always an option at least. In any case, this game will last quite awhile. I couldn't tell you where Streets of Fury EX stands among the classics, but it is one of the finest beatemups released in the 21st century.

I hope that's saying something.

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018512090', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1531709665}
review: It's like Tekken Force and Mortal Kombat had a baby.  A beatiful badass brawler baby.  Each character has a staggering number of special movies, on par with a fighting game moreso than a beatemup.  This gimes combat a depth that's almost always lacking from beatemups and helps keep the combat feeling fresh and interesting time after time.  I'm a big fan of beatemup games, I've been playing them since Double Dragon I, even though more often than not they're horrible button mashing monstrosities, so when I say this is one of the best beatemups I've ever played, it's worth paying attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016444009', 'num_games_owned': 1671, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1535252156}
review:
実写？キャラが1～3ラインで戦うベルトアクションゲームです
ジャンプ、ダッシュ、ガード、ライン移動に方向キー＋弱強必殺技に3種類のスペシャル技を使って戦います
キャラの動きや何処かで見たことあるような技に笑いが止まらなくなると思います
お手軽に空中コンボもできるのでプレイしてて楽しいが
HA持ちの敵に対しての攻撃があまりないのに対して敵はワンパンでガードをぶち破ったり
お手玉されるどうにもならないのでそこが残念（バーストは一応あるが地に足つけてないと意味が無い）
難易度ノーマルくらいでサクッとやるのが一番楽しいと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197960462168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1587846025}
review:
Pure, stupid fun.  That's Streets of Fury EX in a nutshell.  It reminds me of the sort of game a bunch of my buddies in high school and I might have made, had digital cameras and cheap chromakey software been widely available then.  But underneath the somewhat amateurish look is a surprisingly deep and fun side-scrolling beat 'em up, with tight controls and a robust combo system.  Stringing together multi-hit beatdowns is a snap, and each of the many unlockable characters has a full arsenal of combat moves, including chargable super attacks.  Up to four players can join in local co-op, and survival and challenge modes are also available.  Sadly, there's no online play, nor is there a training mode to practice your combos.       

If the game seems familiar, that's because it originally made its debut in 2007 on the Xbox Indie Games service, and was a finalist in the the 2008 Dream Build Play competition.  The 360 version was fun, but clearly constrained by limitations of the hardware and the platform.  The smooth animation of the video-captured sprites meant that only a few actors were used, and their footage spread across multiple characters with extremely similar movesets.  In a genre that's already heavy on repitition, that's not a good thing.  But for the remaster, the developers added a slew of new, distinct brawlers, many of whom parody popular fighting game icons (check out the martial artist with his Ryu-style Shin Shoryuken, or the scarf-wearing send-up of Street Fighter 3's Q).  Guard Crush Games even apparently got one of their dads to play the end boss!  The fighting system has also been revised, with some control changes and a "stamina" meter added, which can be used for powerful special moves or to block enemy attacks.  

Overall, this is definitely worth a look even if you played the original eight years ago (yikes, has it really been that long?).

author: {'steamid': '76561197974802174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1550059028}
review: I haven't laughed so hard while playing a game in only god knows how long. I recommend this game highly, especially if you used to drop large amounts of money at the arcades during the 90s :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037826267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1552127948}
review:
I sunk a huge amount of time into the original Xbox 360 version of the game, and Streets of Fury is one of my favourite indie games from last gen. I was pretty amped to discover that they were planning on doing a PC version of this, so I've been patiently waiting...

Streets of Fury is a throwback to late 80's - early 90's arcade style beat-em ups done in the style of games like old-skool Mortal Kombat using digitized sprites. Streets of Fury sports a very competent and deep combo system that is simple and pick-up-and-playable for beginners, while more experienced players can string together ridiculously long combos that look like something out of a high level MvC2 or Skullgirls match...

The EX version takes everything from the original and simply expands & improves on it.

[b]+[/b] Larger roster of playable characters.
[b]+[/b] New enemy types. And unique sprites for all of them :D
[b]+[/b] New game modes.
[b]+[/b] Higher res sprites, and improved environment visuals/variety.
[b]+[/b] Gameplay tweaks & streamlined control scheme.
[b]+[/b] Some new music as well.


[h1]Some notable changes from the original:[/h1]
+ With the dash and lane switching tied to the direction keys, it means you can play this game with a keyboard & fight stick perfectly fine. In the original, you were required to use the triggers to dash, and switch lanes...

+ The stamina meter, is a simple addition to the game but changes the way you'll need to approach this game if you're coming from the original version. Basically, whenever you use a special attack it requires some stamina and if you run out then you won't be able to do any special attacks until it fills up a bit... R.I.P gun-cancel infinite spam :(
Where things get complicated is that your stamina meter also doubles as your guard/armor meter so blocking attacks reduces your stamina and losing all your stamina causes you to guard break. It should be noted that both players and enemies use stamina.


And while I do like this game, there are some glaring omissions, and just some general stuff I don't like with this version.

[h1]Stuff missing:[/h1]
- Character movelists from the original. Seriously why was this not included???
- Combo tutorial videos. I found these very useful, and having these videos in the original gave players an easy way to see what the general playstyle of the characters were, as well as a basis for building combos.

[h1]General annoyances:[/h1]
- 2015, and still no online play for both the co-op and versus :(
- The button prompts in this game do not reflect your current control scheme and prompt simply assume that you're playing this game with an Xbox 360 pad using the default key binds.
- Characters are locked behind a level gate again, sigh... The variety of characters, and mastery of the characters already give you enough incentive to replay this game IMO, so this is just pointless grinding...
- This is just a personal nitpick, but I really did not like the inclusion of the enemy that swears all the time. It was something that really stuck out like a sore thumb for me, and IMO doesn't gel with the silly, playful nature of this game. Fortunately they included a language-filter option for that guy lol.


[h1]Overall Rating:[/h1]
- If you're looking for an old-skool arcade brawler with some fighting game sensibilities then I recommend it on account that you're perfectly okay with playing this solo & local co-op/versus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111968405', 'num_games_owned': 2283, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1435147163}
review:
NOTE: Key was provided by developer for testing

Streets of Fury EX is classic beat 'em up game. What separate it from rest of this genre games is 4 co-op multiplayer and quite enough of game modes. These mods especialy if you play them with friends will guarantie you lots of hours of fun.

As for in-game I especially found damn funny character emotes, where every one of playable characters have its own unique, and its fun, realy fun :)

Controls are easy to get, and begginers shouldnt find hard to manage it.
About graphic and sound there is not much to say, It doesent stand up from games of this genre.

My personal opinion is that indie game like this should be price tagged not more then 4,99€ (5,99$), If it had that price I would instantly recomended as must buy.

As for recommendation, lovers of beat 'em up games BUY IT, rest of you guys wait for discount. It is a game that you should give it a try anyway.

My overall rating is 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056097444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1642270213}
review:
More fun then I expected.  Saw this little gem when it was a xbox indie title.  Now its on PC and you'd be foolish to pass up on a beat em up with limitless combo potenial with tons of characters each bringing their own moveset to the table, a fun atmosphere that doesnt take itself seriesouly.  I truly, truly cant reccomend this anymore without forcing you to buy this at gunpoint.  

The only thing i'd complain about is the lack of a parry system, a parry system would complete this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987171735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1435499473}
review:
Веселая и прикольная игра. Чем-то напомнила старую добрую игру - Двойной дракон на популярной 8-битной Dendy из 90-х. Каждый персонаж обладает уникальными комбо. 
Суть игры - мочилово направо и налево :D Прошел компанию за 1.9  часа на легком уровне.
Есть различные уровни сложности и режимы. 
Не хватает режима игры по сети с друзьями.
Рекомендую поиграть!

review: Ha ha ha ha ha!  I'm surprised that it's pretty fun.  Love the silliness that's put into this game.  Goes to show that you don't need uber awesome graphics in a game to have a good game.  Playability will get you far.  Hoping for a sequel or something.  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011288073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1459003719}
review: My first impressions of this game are that it does not take itself too seriously which comes across well.  Although the game is retro-style the graphics are decent and fit into the theme of the game well.  Also the animations are pretty good and the combos are fun.  I haven't encountered any bugs and the game runs well.  This game is quite humorous and I recommend it for anyone whom wants to support indie developers and likes fighting games as it is a good deal for the price and it is worth adding to your collection.
